title: Akumajou Dracula X - Gekka no Yasoukyoku (Japan) (v1.2) [En by Gemini+Throughhim413 v1.0] + guides & Soundtracks
files: Akumajou Dracula X - Gekka no Yasoukyoku (Japan) (v1.2) [En by Gemini+Throughhim413 v1.0] (Track 2).ape
Akumajou Dracula X - Gekka no Yasoukyoku (Japan) (v1.2) [En by Gemini+Throughhim413 v1.0].cue
Symphony of the Night US-NTSC manual.pdf
Castlevania - Symphony of the Night - Official Guide - Brady Games_text.pdf
Castlevania - Symphony of the Night Survival Guide.pdf
Michiru Yamane - Akumajo Dracula X ~Nocturne in the Moonlight~ OST.log
description:
Castlevania: Symphony of the Night is an action role playing game for the PlayStation.

This game in the Castlevania series departs from the designs of the others, and takes the series into an RPG approach.

Known in Japan as Akumajou Dracula X: Gekka no Yasoukyoku (Demon Castle Dracula X: Nocturne in the Moonlight), this game takes place after the first Dracula X game (specifically, “Dracula X: Rondo of Blood”). You play as Alucard, a returning hero from the third installment of the series on the NES. Alucard is Dracula’s son, who had gone into a deep sleep for many years until he was awakened by the return of Dracula’s castle.

As Alucard, you have a large number of equipment to choose from (daggers, one-handed swords, two-handed swords, fist-type weapons, rods, as well as armor, shields, capes, helmets, accessories, and usable items).

Alucard has many techniques at his disposal. First, he has a large set of spells (about 10 or so) that he can perform by using his MP (one of the three main statistics, in addition to HP and Hearts). He can transform into a Wolf, Bat, and Mist (each of which has a few abilities of their own). He also gets familiars of varying types (demons, faeries, and even a sentient sword) to help fight his enemies.

The game itself is huge. The amount of ground you have covered in the castle can be viewed on a Metroid-style map that takes up just about the entire screen when it’s full. There is also a separate area after the castle which is just as big. There are plenty of secret areas for you to find as well.

This patch features a complete translation, multiple code hacks (8×8 and 8×12 vwf and other fixes for expanding available space on screen and in memory) and several graphical changes, including compressed graphics.

Props to Gemini for this outstanding release!
https://www.patreon.com/classicrebirth
https://www.romhacking.net/translations/1427/

For your own convenience, this release also contains the following documents:

Castlevania: Symphony of the Night - Official Guide - Brady Games_text OCR
Castlevania: Symphony of the Night - Unauthorized Secrets and Soultions OCR
Castlevania: Symphony of the Night Survival Guide OCR
Castlevania: Symphony of the Night US-NTSC manual
&
Castlevania: Symphony of the Night manga (DioBrando)
Castle maps 

As well as the following soundtracks:

Castlevania Symphony Of The Night Complete Soundtrack 
Castlevania- Symphony of the Night (Playstation) (44.1khz) (Evil Akuma)

This is the V2 of my previous original torrent, with additional files and some small fixes.

https://anonfiles.com/7cn2D8h4y9/Symphony_of_the_Night_Ultimate_7z

Enjoy!

title: E.X. Troopers English Translation Patch [3DS] v1.0.1
description:
This is a full English translation patch for E.X. Troopers, a spin-off game in the Lost Planet series and exclusive to Japan on PS3 and 3DS. November 22, 2022 marks the 10th anniversary of the game’s original release.

After 7 years of working on this project, we are excited to finally share our results. We have faced so many challenges while translating this game, ranging from reverse engineering the game's files, overcoming multiple technical limitations of the game's engine, translating over 17,000 individual Japanese lines, replacing hundreds of speech bubbles in pre-rendered videos, to releasing this patch for two completely different systems simultaneously.

We have poured so much into making this and are proud to finally release it.

#### Changelog (v1.0.1):

[3DS/PS3]
• Fixed some minor text issues and improved some multiplayer translations.

[3DS]
• Fixed a bug in an Ep 2 video where subtitles would not render properly.
• Fixed a bug in an Ep 5 video where it would not play properly.

[PS3]
• Added 140 new Bubtitles to Ep 2 video.
• Fixed a bug in Ep 4 where some videos did not play audio loud enough.
• Updated Gallery thumbnails.

description:
──Somehow everything around you felt unfamiliar.

“Indecent male dog should speak honestly~” the beautiful master trampled me on the ground and looked down at me.

[![FastPic.Ru](https://i116.fastpic.org/thumb/2022/0221/0b/66cdea7debacb158827b4a6ac75f240b.jpeg)](https://fastpic.org/view/116/2022/0221/66cdea7debacb158827b4a6ac75f240b.jpg.html)

◆Featured Systems

◇Full CG mode can be turned on in the environment setting, and HCG can be freely browsed.

◇Pressure-Free Operation Support one-click mouse operation-Fast text-to-text system

◆Story

Master said that I’m full of sexual desire

If I want to cure my perverted behavior, I should wear the chastity sheath

“Even the chastity sheath can’t cure you… seems that you need to be trained hard."

I had always been a very horny guy. I would think about H things all day that my master called me a male dog on heat…

But then I suddenly wanted to cure my perverted behavior

Could I succeed?

However, along with the training progress, I felt like I became more horny

Was that normal? Was she… really my master?
◆How to Play

The main gameplay is to live with your beautiful “master”. Along with the storyline development, the “master” would train you with various S&M methods.

Your choices will bring you to different endings.

This game has many unique H events.

Along with the game progress, you may unlock various H positions.

There are even fantastic potion training and magical transformation.

But in your sweet sexual life, you slightly felt indisposed.

If you insisted on leaving, you would face the irreversible physical training.

Would you choose your downfall or try to escape that small house?
◆Game Characteristic

◇16 Basic CG, Including More Than 200 Different Pictures

◇Game Text: 50.000 words

◇Training M Game

◇Game Ending：5 Types

title: Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel Offline (PC)
description:
This the Master Duel Offline (PC Only) and don't need to log in on steam just run the Ygomaster.exe and YgoMasterClient.exe together in the game folder

(credits to Pixeltris who created the mod, make the game offline and update the mod based on latest of the game) 

Website: https://github.com/pixeltris/YgoMaster

Notes in this like README (Important)
- Do not run the masterduel.exe because it opens Steam client only the Ygomaster.exe and YgoMasterClient.exe in the game folder
- Note in Secret Pack shop that you can get Royal finish is rigged for UR and SR rarity in the game (because i experimented it) but in other shops i can't modify the Normal and Bonus Shop
- You can play with offline AI with custom decks and you can import YDK files too (from ygopro, edopro, etc.)
- I put some decks from Link Evolution and real life TCG/OCG starter and structure decks by rename the folders to like "Link Evolution Decks" / "OCG TCG Decks" to "Decks" but make sure to back up your own deck that you play or more to conflict
- In Data folder you can edit some files but with caution because some of .json files can delete your save file or else but the editable .json files are Player.json (for player info only) and Settings.json (for offline settings)
- Banlist disabled in Settings.json
- Be careful if you'll experiment about json files and make sure you'll back up the original files
- Public Decks works in the offline mod
- Duel pass and Bundle Deal doesn't work since its for online server only
- You can buy Mates, Duel Field, Protector and Icons in the offline mod
- Updated with Weather Painter Solo Mode and Pixeltris will update in the future

have fun with the offline mod with just AI :D

Screenshots: https://imgur.com/a/G3Nk0N1

title: Muv-Luv Alternative Total Eclipse Remastered (ENG)
description:
![MLA](https://otomi-games.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/capsule_616x353-2-2.webp "MLA")

In the year 2001, the Japanese Empire’s attempt to
develop a next-generation Tactical Surface Fighter for
their army had hit a dead end. To solve this problem,
they decided to work with the American government to
build upon their 3rd Generation TSF, the Shiranui.
The project was given the code name XFJ, and Takamura Yui,
a 1st Lieutenant in the Royal Guard, was put in charge of it.

Yui had always been against any attempts to work with
other countries to develop a new TSF, and she departed for
Alaska’s Yukon base with a heart laden with worry and dissatisfaction.

2nd Lieutenant Yuuya Bridges, an American, was also
headed to Yukon Base as well. He'd been chosen as
the main test pilot of the XFJ Project, and hated Japan
because of the sad circumstances of his birth.
He too, was very unhappy with the project.

Of course, the two quickly collided, and completion
of the project seemed impossible.
But if it failed, Japan was doomed...

Set on an Earth pushed to the brink of destruction,
Total Eclipse is an intense human drama
about the race to develop a new TSF!

****

# Description'
THIS ISNT ON THE SAME LEVEL AS SH2EE
These are only fixed to the game and its bugs/features
Not full on restoration and upgrading of textures and such.

Uses some fixes from PCGamingWiki
Uses 16:9 FMV Pack by CataBridge
Uses PC fix by Steam006 

# How to use.
You will launch the game from a programm called DLLInjector.exe
This is from the PC fix by Steam006, windows defender will try to delete the file, allow it, It injects the games DLLs to fix bugs and add new features.
Since this is based on the GOG version which is based on the European PC version, they have fixed higher resolutions and controller support.

You can configure the resolution and such with a program called dxcfg.exe

Genre: Puzzle, Escape Game, Visual Novel

Full remake of the 2016 releases. Changed from portrait to landscape orientation, fully voiced, and additional CGs and stories.

Description:

In the middle of a family visit, a pair of masked children appear before Mai Sahara and beseech her to help their mother in pain. She follows them, only to soon find herself at a shrine deep within the mountains that she is not at all familiar with. Imigo, a resident of the shrine, is less than pleased to see Mai at his dwelling and sends her off, but some mysterious power seems to be keen on keeping her there. Only then does Imigo agree to help Mai find a way to leave the shrine safely, and thus begins their journey, with Mai taking a step towards discovering the truth behind her past.

title: SNES ROM Collection
description:
![image](https://assets.reedpopcdn.com/wikipedia_snes_pal.jpg/BROK/resize/1200x1200%3E/format/jpg/quality/70/wikipedia_snes_pal.jpg)

Here come the 16bit games! Here's the SNES collection, one of my all time favorites. There were SO MANY good games on this, in every single genre you could think of. If you thought the NES was amazing (and it was), the SNES blows it out of the water. The games, on the other hand, don't always. See, the beginning of the 16bit era of games started the so called "bit wars", where some game makers started to believe that what really mattered in games were the graphics. So many of them started focusing on the visual aspect instead of the gaming one. Sounds familiar? Yeah... But there are still a huge number of fantastic SNES games. It's just that some of the other games have so much stuff happening on screen that it can hurt. I'm serious. There are a few shooters that I can't play because of too many flashing lights, too many colors, and too many things on screen. Thankfully, the later games stared toning this down. Just in time for the 3D age to come around and do it again. God, humans are stupid. Anyways, the folders:

**SNES Europe ROMs**: Few Europe exclusive games. Again, not many, because most games were released in both NA and EU.

**SNES Japanese ROMs**: Sadly, more then half the SNES library never made it out of Japan. And here are the ones that are in Japanese. The number of ones you can still play is much lower then in the previous generation, because of all the text that they could pun on screen now. Still, plenty of shooting games. Don't even bother with the RPGs though. 

**SNES Lightgun ROMs**: I say "lightgun" but the SNES had a bazooka. It was not popular. I can see why. Stick to the NES games for lighguns, because the Super Scope was a terrible idea and a terrible execution. Oh, some of them you can play with the mouse. And one of them with the Justifer.

**SNES North America ROMs**: The other half of the library. Some of them I excluded because you can find better versions in the next folder.

**SNES Translated Japan ROMs**: Oh, baby! RPG heaven. And not only. But what might have caught your eyes are the "Heartthrob Memorial" extra files. This one's an oddity. The wonderful people from http://translated.games translated this game, then made a special patch that inserts an opening animation plus voices for the heroines. I've never seen that done before, so I had to include it. I don't think all emulators support this though.

I use snes9x for my main emulator. It works great. One more thing: you might try and add up all the games and see that there are more games then the official licensed numbers. That's cause some betas and prototypes are also included... just not labeled cause I lost track. And I'm not going through the whole list again. Also, they all work. So enjoy.

title: Super Nintendo (SNES) US, EU & JP (TRANSLATED) ROM Collection
description:
![image](https://i.ibb.co/MDgf4wZ/SNES.png)

This was a lot more work then I thought it would be. It did not go as smoothly as the NES collection, but it's also because I added something extra for you guys. 
Now, I know the official numbers are 721 for the US, with 34 exclusives for Europe. Well, screw those numbers cause I I could not find 721 for USA. Most list either have double entries or have some military training simulator, or the freaking SuperScope as a separate entry. And as for the Europe exclusives, I have 47? Well, not exactly. Some of the ROMs for the USA version were corrupted, so I used ROMs from Europe. It still doesn't add up and I ended the collection with  6 extra games. How? No clue, I stopped caring after the 3 or 4th list. 

But here's what really took a lot of time: I went and found (what I hope are) all the fully translated Japanese ROMs. That's 208 games right there, and some of them are really, really good. About half of them are JRPGs or SRPGs, so enjoy. Now, I can't actually promise that there are all 100% translated all the way to the end, cause I didn't finish all these games. Huge shout-out to romhacking.net, where I got the list for all known fully translated games (even though the list has a few entries that are actually wrong, like Captain Tsubasa III and Wizardry I-III, who do not have working translations), and where I got the patches for the Japanese ROMs. The patches are already applied to the ROMs, so you don't have to do anything. The ones with version numbers at the end I found already patched, while the rest I patched myself.

So, enjoy this collection. I can't call it "complete" because I'm not certain it is, but I doubt you'll find anything better any time soon. Just as last time just one copy per game*, all tested to be working.

*there are a few games that I included as both official USA/EU ROMs and translated JP ROMs. For example, TwinBee - Rainbow Bell Adventure was gutted in the official EU release (story and gameplay removed), but I still kept the EU version.

title: [Android] WHITE ALBUM2 DREAM COMMUNICATION
description:
A curious little game/app where you can dress up the two main heroines from WHITE ALBUM2 and "train" them and so on  
A very barebones, frankly low quality attempt by Aquaplus to cash in on the mobile game trend, and the lack of quality and content in general explains why this app died quickly, being taken off stores by 2016  
As such, this app is old and may not even work on some modern phones (it failed to launch on my Poco X3 for example)  
Not much to it either way  
And yet there's a strange kind of charm to it, I suppose  
  
Really I just wanted more Kazusa after going through the WHITE ALBUM2 VN and couldn't get her out of my head   
  
![alt text][logo]  
  
[logo]: https://i.imgur.com/enXfnq3.png "Cute tsun maid"  
  
(The little bits of dialogue here is all voiced, including the above, which is nice)  
  
Uploading here just in case there's another weirdo like me who would be interested in it and has an old enough device to run it  
I've modified the APK included here to unlock the in-app purchases by default, as you can't actually get any of them legally anymore  
  
How-to:  
Install APK  
Copy Android folder to /sdcard/  
Run the app and MAYBE it'll start

title: Nintendo Entertainment System USA & EU ROMS
description:
![image](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/82/NES-Console-Set.jpg/1280px-NES-Console-Set.jpg)

I wanted to download a collection of all licensed NES ROMS for US and EU. But it was harder then I thought. All the compilations I found either had 100+ versions of the same game, or were mixed with unlicensed or Famicom games, or had ROMs that just didn't work. I just wanted the licensed English games. So, I spent a few hours making this. It contains all 677 licensed cartridges from the US and 35 from EU.

"But according to Wikipedia, there are 678 games licensed in the US.", I hear you saying. True, and I spend a lot of time looking for that missing game. Turns out, there is none. Short Order & Eggsplode! are two separate games, but share the same cartridge. 

"But I thought there were 36 games released outside of the US. You only have 35.". True. But only 35 were released in EU. The missing, 36th game was only released in Hong Hong, and is the rarest NES cartridge with only around 10 copies known. It's a mahjong game, do you aren't missing out on anything. 

All games work, all games have only one version. It's simple, it's efficient, it's complete. Enjoy.

The Super Mario/Duck Hunt/ World Class Track Meet games are here more then once, because they were released on different cartridges, and count as a separate one.

title: SEGA Master System ROM Collection
description:
![image](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/Sega-Master-System-Set.jpg/1200px-Sega-Master-System-Set.jpg)

It's time for the Sega Master System, or Sega Mark III in Japan. Launched about two years after the Famicom, this rival had a hard time gaining followers in Japan and the US. Sega had a completely different way of making games for its system. They were the only ones actually making the games, unlike Nintendo who would also hire out studios. This means that the library for the Master System was much smaller, at a little over 300 games, but that the quality control would be, in theory, higher. The Master System wound up gaining most of its followers in Europe, especially Brazil, where the system could be purchased up until the later 2000s (well done, TecToy). Hell, almost half of the consoles sold were sold in Brazil. So with that said, let's get to the folders.

**SEGA Master System Brazil ROMs**: Yup, they have their own folder. Because they have their own exclusives. Some of them are just reskins of existing games, but now featuring popular Brazilian characters. Others are ports of Genesis or Game Gear games. A few are actual original games.

**SEGA Master System Europe ROMs**: This is where you'll find most of the games. Since the Master System was more popular in Europe, almost all exclusives are here.

**SEGA Master System Japan ROMs**: There were very few Japan only games for the Master System, since Sega was in charge of the games. And most of these you can play without actually knowing Japanese.

**SEGA Master System Japan (Translated) ROMs**: The ones that were text heavy were translated. Again, not many games here.

**SEGA Master System North America ROMs**: Yup, just 10 games were exclusive for North America. Not much to say about them. 

**SEGA Master System Prototype ROMs**: Here's a few prototypes that never actually made it to commercial games. 

You might notice that there are no unlicensed games for the Master System. That because Sega would not allow anyone else to make games for them. 

Oh, and for an emulator, I recommend Gearsystem. Enjoy.

title: E.X. Troopers English Translation Patch [PS3] v1.0.1
description:
This is a full English translation patch for E.X. Troopers, a spin-off game in the Lost Planet series and exclusive to Japan on PS3 and 3DS. November 22, 2022 marks the 10th anniversary of the game’s original release.

After 7 years of working on this project, we are excited to finally share our results. We have faced so many challenges while translating this game, ranging from reverse engineering the game's files, overcoming multiple technical limitations of the game's engine, translating over 17,000 individual Japanese lines, replacing hundreds of speech bubbles in pre-rendered videos, to releasing this patch for two completely different systems simultaneously.

We have poured so much into making this and are proud to finally release it.

#### Changelog (v1.0.1):

[3DS/PS3]
• Fixed some minor text issues and improved some multiplayer translations.

[3DS]
• Fixed a bug in an Ep 2 video where subtitles would not render properly.
• Fixed a bug in an Ep 5 video where it would not play properly.

[PS3]
• Added 140 new Bubtitles to Ep 2 video.
• Fixed a bug in Ep 4 where some videos did not play audio loud enough.
• Updated Gallery thumbnails.

title: Beatmania IIDX 28 BISTROVER LDJ-2021083000 KONAMI/BEMANI Arcade Rhythm Game
description:
This is a rhythm game like osu!mania or DJMax, with 7 keys and 1 turntable.

Before opening the game:

- Right click the volume icon > Sounds > Click on the Default Device > Properties > Advanced > 2 channel, 16 bit, 44100 Hz
- Open spicecfg.exe, set your buttons, go to “Cards” then click “Generate”.

To play the game and save scores:

- Open asphyxia-core-win-x64.exe then spice64.exe
- Press + on the numpad to insert your card

ゲームを開く前に：

- 音量アイコンを右クリック > サウンド > デフォルトのデバイスをクリック > プロパティ > 詳細 > 2チャンネル、16ビット、44100 Hz
- spicecfg.exeを開き、ボタンを設定し、「Cards」に移動して、「Generate」をクリックします。

ゲームをプレイしてスコアを保存するには：

- asphyxia-core-win-x64.exeを開き、次にspice64.exeを開きます
- テンキーの+を押して、カードを挿入します

title: NES & Famicom ROM Collection
description:
![image](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/82/NES-Console-Set.jpg/1280px-NES-Console-Set.jpg)

My previous torrent, which is now hidden, seemed incomplete to me. Because it was. While it did contain all the North America and Europe ROMs, it just didn't seem enough. So here's a new torrent that contains both NES and Famicom games. Let me explain the folders a little.

**NES North America ROMs**: Self explanatory. Games that were released in North America. This does not mean they were exclusive to NA though. Note: there are some games that you might think are missing from this folder, but they're not, because I included the superior original Japanese version. Also, you will see some games with the tag [Relocalized]. This means that it's a NA version patched to fix translation errors, or to update the names to current canon ones. 

**NES Europe ROMs**: Also self explanatory. Games that were exclusive to Europe. A lot of the games in the NA folder were also released in Europe, but there's no point in having them twice.

**NES Japan ROMs**: Here's where it gets interesting. These are games released in Japan that are still in Japanese. Some of these you can still play, but the RPGs, visual novels, strategy games? Forget about it. I also kept some games that have a NA counterpart simply because the original is so different from the NA version.

**NES Translated Japan ROMs**: Now here's the good stuff. All fully translated Japanese games. A ton of RPGs, adventure games, strategy games, and more. There's almost as many translated Japanese games are there are untranslated (353 VS 368). 

**NES Lightgun ROMs**: These are the lightgun games. I thought it would be best if they were in their separate folder. These are still fun with a mouse.

**NES Camerica ROMs**: While I wanted to include only actual licensed games by Nintendo, I made an exception for Camarica because I like their games. They really tried to make good stuff, and for the most part, they did. This is their entire library. I adore their music. 

For an emulator, I recommend Mesen. It works with 99% of games. There are a few (I think about 5) that did not start with Mesen at all. For those, use my second choice: fceux. 

It was a giant pain in the ass to make this. I had to test all the games and find working copies of the ones that didn't work. The biggest pain was making sure that there are no untranslated ROMs in the Japan folder that have translated version if the Translated folder, cause the names don't match at all. There might still be a few double left. I hope not. I am certain you'll find a lot of fun games here. I sure as hell did. They're old as hell, but they are still so much fun to play. Enjoy. And look forward to the next release: Sega Master System.

title: Tsukihime OG Timeline
description:
This is a collection of Tsukihime's Original Timeline for archival purposes. Anything I could get my hands on I have placed in here. For future reference, I will try to get the first print editions of these games however the TsukiBako versions were the versions that survived online and are the way more common ones. So those are the ones in this torrent. These games are not pre-patched but I have included the English patches for those who wish to do so.

This torrent includes
Games
-Tsukihime TsukiBako Edition / English Patch v1.1 and v1.2 [Mirror Moon]
-PLUS+DISK TsukiBako Edition / English Patch v1.2 [Mirror Moon]
-Kagetsu Tohya TsukiBako Edition / English Patch v0.5.2 [Lunacy]
-Tsukihime PSP and GBA
-Kagetsu Tohya GBA
Music
-Artifacts
-Lunar Legend Original Soundtrack
-Ever After
Books
-Period Plus
-Lunar Legend
-Melty Blood
-Melty Blood Game Guide
-Tsukihime Anime Visual Guidebook
-CLAIR de LUNE Illustration Anthology

For the rest of the Tsukihime timeline, I will refer you to https://nyaa.si/view/1042489
It is a torrent made by Mar2ck that features all of the Melty Blood games which finishes the Original Timeline for Tsukihime.
I have not added the thing that shall not be named for obvious reasons however if you wish to experience it you can find it here https://nyaa.si/view/1487827
Tsukihime HD and Kagetsu Tohya HD can be found here https://mega.nz/folder/g8hhiK7K#7JSDyBP_aBERfynJ4tapww

Missing Files that I could not find
-Tsukihime Preview, Trial and Half-moon editions [These are included in PLUS+DISK however they are not burned from the original discs]
-Melty Blood Trial Edition and 2.0 [1.2 edition is located in PLUS+DISK]
-Melty Blood PS2 and Arcade Editions [PS2 might be able to be found but the Arcade editions will likely never be found or even be able to be uploaded to the internet]
-Melty Blood X
-Melty Blood Nightmare

If any of you have these or any other Tsukihime content from the original canon please link where you can find these in the comments below.

You can find me on discord @Shido Itsuka#1644

description:
Having been disappointed with Sega's Sonic Origins, I ended up just getting the Android versions of the remakes by Christian Whitehead and settled with that.

Sonic 1 - Remake
Sonic 2 - Remake
Sonic 3 - Emulated (the A.I.R. version is in Beta and looks very buggy, so your best bet is using the emulator included and try out the filters to improve the picture quality)
Sonic CD - Remake

If you want to play the awesome Sonic SMS Remakes, get them [here](https://sonic-sms-remake.blogspot.com/).

Note 1: Sonic CD "Ouya Edition" apk is a "demo" (can be unlocked via a Ouya as a full game) meaning you only get to play the first stage, and I included that as it doesn't show the directional pad on the screen, but if you use a keyboard (physical/digital), and press the button "Esc" it will be hidden (tested on the "Original" version), anyway.

Note 2: If you need help to get Sonic 3 A.I.R. to work, read the instructions [here](https://sonic3air.org/download/android.html).

Note 3: "Mod" just means no ads.
